The addition of auth type 30 had broken backward compatibility with
Mac OS X machines configured to share screen if a client authenticates
via a VNC password. bVNC was picking auth type 30 even if the user name
field was not set in the settings, and when this auth type was chosen

for that user name rather than a VNC password. Now, if a user name is not
supplied to bVNC, auth type 30 is not chosen and authentication falls
through to auth type 2.

How ignoring left Alt only if keyboard ID indicates that it is the default hardware keyboard (is 0).

This allows us to use it for symbol input on such keyboards and for Alt in any other scenario.

Additionally, a bugfix for aRDP and aSPICE where a static method needed to become public in aRDP.java
and aSPICE.java.

Finally, there is a bugfix for aSPICE where the native libraries were loaded in aSPICE and if an
intent is used to start RemoteCanvasActivity directly they would not be loaded. The loading of
native libs and initializing of Gstreamer was moved back to SpiceCommunicator.java.
